alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, east central Laurel, Bell, Knox, western Leslie, southeastern Whitley and Clay Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fall Rock to Fount to near Wheeler. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manchester, Hammond, Salt Gum, Cottongin, Jonsee, Littleton, Scalf, Urban, Horse Creek Junction and Byron around 320 PM EDT. Ogle, House, Park Valley, Bluehole and Meldrum around 325 PM EDT. Lipps, Brightshade, Ice Cliff, Botto, Goose Rock, Old Flat Lick, Barcreek, Boho, Ferndale and Spurlock around 330 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Plank, Straight Creek, Ashers Fork, East Pineville, Ponza, Calvin, Dewitt, Gardner, Blanche, Arjay, Cary, Creekville, Spring Creek, Kettle Island, Miracle, Roark, Queendale, Varilla, Rella, Marcum, Field, Stony Fork Junction, Bear Branch, Bobs Fork, Callaway, Big Creek, Essie and Peabody. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Clay; Harlan; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; Whitley
